text: ❔Before we get started, we have a few questions to make this journey personalised:

SourceText: 📲 How would you prefer to receive content —through mostly text / images or with audio guides?
text: 📲 How would you prefer to receive content —through mostly text / images or with audio guides?

SourceText: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.
text: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.

SourceText: Are you a WOMAN or MAN?
text: Are you a WOMAN or MAN?

SourceText: How many children do you take care of?
text: How many children do you take care of?

SourceText: These tips are designed for those who look after children. Would you still like to receive the tips so you can share the advice with friends and family?
text: These tips are designed for those who look after children. Would you still like to receive the tips so you can share the advice with friends and family?

SourceText: Thank you for your time.
text: Thank you for your time.

text: 📍 Where are you located?

SourceText: This is a very difficult and dangerous time for you and your family. These tips might be different from what you need right now. What would you like to do?
text: This is a very difficult and dangerous time for you and your family. These tips might be different from what you need right now. What would you like to do?

SourceText: The tips you will receive in this programme have been developed with support from Sanadak, Anar for Empowerment and Psychosocial Support, World Without Orphans, and Parenting for Lifelong Health.
text: The tips you will receive in this programme have been developed with support from Sanadak, Anar for Empowerment and Psychosocial Support, World Without Orphans, and Parenting for Lifelong Health.

SourceText: 🧡 You are a great parent. Thank you for joining us.
text: 🧡 You are a great parent. Thank you for joining us.

SourceText: ✅ Participating in ParentText is optional.
text: ✅ Participating in ParentText is optional.

SourceText: ✅ We won’t ever ask for your name. Anything you share is safe, private, and anonymous.
text: ✅ We won’t ever ask for your name. Anything you share is safe, private, and anonymous.

SourceText: ✅Your anonymous information may also be shared with others working to help families like yours build strength and hope in tough times. All your information will be private and can’t be linked back to you.
text: ✅Your anonymous information may also be shared with others working to help families like yours build strength and hope in tough times. All your information will be private and can’t be linked back to you.

text: Press YES if you understand and want to receive ParentText. Type 'EXIT' if you do not wish to participate.

SourceText: Thank you! 🤲 We hope these tips will help you build strength and hope for you and your family.
text: Thank you! 🤲 We hope these tips will help you build strength and hope for you and your family.

SourceText: Are you sure you do not want to get these messages? If you do not want to receive any more messages, please type NO. If you made a mistake, please press BACK and choose another option.
text: Are you sure you do not want to get these messages? If you do not want to receive any more messages, please type NO. If you made a mistake, please press BACK and choose another option.

SourceText: Thanks for answering our questions. We're ready to get started. 💚
text: Thanks for answering our questions. We're ready to get started. 💚

SourceText: To start, you can watch this video to learn about ParentText.
text: To start, you can watch this video to learn about ParentText.

SourceText: Variables have been reset
text: Variables have been reset

SourceText: Welcome to ParentText. Every parent everywhere needs support. We hope we can help. 💚
text: Welcome to ParentText. Every parent everywhere needs support. We hope we can help. 💚

SourceText: *A Friendly Chat*
text: *A Friendly Chat*

SourceText: Talk to your children about something that they are interested in! 😃
text: Talk to your children about something that they are interested in! 😃

SourceText: ⚽ An easy way to start talking to your children is to ask them about something they are interested in. For example, you could talk about local stories, traditions, sports, favourite books, friends, music, famous people or something they have been learning about.
text: ⚽ An easy way to start talking to your children is to ask them about something they are interested in. For example, you could talk about local stories, traditions, sports, favourite books, friends, music, famous people or something they have been learning about.

SourceText: 👂 You may not find everything your children share to be interesting, but it’s important to show enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn.
text: 👂 You may not find everything your children share to be interesting, but it’s important to show enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn.

SourceText: Paying attention to what matters to your children can make a big difference in your relationship and their happiness.
text: Paying attention to what matters to your children can make a big difference in your relationship and their happiness.

SourceText: *Reflect on Hope*
text: *Reflect on Hope*

SourceText: Spread Hope!
text: Spread Hope!

SourceText: 💡 Together, take a minute to think about all the things you did today.
text: 💡 Together, take a minute to think about all the things you did today.

SourceText: ☀️ Take turns sharing one positive thing that happened. This could be something small or big, like feeling good because you took a pause to take some deep breaths, exercised like walking or stretching, or spent time with people you care about.
text: ☀️ Take turns sharing one positive thing that happened. This could be something small or big, like feeling good because you took a pause to take some deep breaths, exercised like walking or stretching, or spent time with people you care about.

SourceText: ⏰ Try doing this every day - even more on the days it feels like you have not done anything special.
text: ⏰ Try doing this every day - even more on the days it feels like you have not done anything special.

SourceText: *What’s New?*
text: *What’s New?*

SourceText: Learning is fun! 🎓
text: Learning is fun! 🎓

SourceText: ❓ Ask your children to think of a new, fun skill you could learn together.
text: ❓ Ask your children to think of a new, fun skill you could learn together.

SourceText: For example, keeping a ball in the air with your foot, learning and practising local language phrases, sharing stories from your culture, playing local games and sports, or learning a new song.
text: For example, keeping a ball in the air with your foot, learning and practising local language phrases, sharing stories from your culture, playing local games and sports, or learning a new song.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns trying out the new skill. Make sure to praise each other and learn and play together!
text: 🔄 Take turns trying out the new skill. Make sure to praise each other and learn and play together!

SourceText: 💛 Approach learning the skill in a kind and fun way, and do not judge your children or yourself for your ability in the skill.
text: 💛 Approach learning the skill in a kind and fun way, and do not judge your children or yourself for your ability in the skill.

SourceText: *Check-in Chat*
text: *Check-in Chat*

SourceText: Actively checking in on one another helps to keep relationships healthy! ⭐
text: Actively checking in on one another helps to keep relationships healthy! ⭐

SourceText: Ask each other questions like: “What made you happy today?” 👂 “What was difficult today?” 👂 “How can I help you?” 👂
text: Ask each other questions like: “What made you happy today?” 👂 “What was difficult today?” 👂 “How can I help you?” 👂

SourceText: For this to help, your children need to feel safe while sharing things with you. Be open to their responses. 💚
text: For this to help, your children need to feel safe while sharing things with you. Be open to their responses. 💚

SourceText: Older children tend to be more honest when they trust that what they say will not be used against them later.
text: Older children tend to be more honest when they trust that what they say will not be used against them later.

SourceText: Be kind to yourself if your children do not want to share their problems with you. 💙 Often, children are afraid to share as they are scared they will get in trouble. Getting upset with them won’t help - keep showing you love them and give them time! 🌷
text: Be kind to yourself if your children do not want to share their problems with you. 💙 Often, children are afraid to share as they are scared they will get in trouble. Getting upset with them won’t help - keep showing you love them and give them time! 🌷

SourceText: *Express Yourself*
text: *Express Yourself*

SourceText: Movement makes people happy!
text: Movement makes people happy!

SourceText: This game can be played in pairs or as a group - stand facing each other or in a circle.
text: This game can be played in pairs or as a group - stand facing each other or in a circle.

SourceText: 🎵 Together, choose a song, a fun sound, or a clapping pattern to follow and choose a person to start the game by creating one movement.
text: 🎵 Together, choose a song, a fun sound, or a clapping pattern to follow and choose a person to start the game by creating one movement.

SourceText: 👀 The person to their right must copy that movement and add their own movement to it.
text: 👀 The person to their right must copy that movement and add their own movement to it.

SourceText: ✨ Go around the circle, each person adding a new movement.
text: ✨ Go around the circle, each person adding a new movement.

SourceText: 🔄 The first one who forgets someone's movements or does it in the wrong order chooses the next song, sound, or pattern and starts the game again.
text: 🔄 The first one who forgets someone's movements or does it in the wrong order chooses the next song, sound, or pattern and starts the game again.

SourceText: 🎉 Have fun trying out different movements together with this fun game.
text: 🎉 Have fun trying out different movements together with this fun game.

SourceText: *2 Truths, 1 Lie*
text: *2 Truths, 1 Lie*

SourceText: This is a fun, quick game, and the point of it is to learn things about each other. Make your answers as interesting as possible! 🎨
text: This is a fun, quick game, and the point of it is to learn things about each other. Make your answers as interesting as possible! 🎨

SourceText: 💡 Everyone thinks of 3 facts about themselves. 2 must be true, and 1 must be a lie.
text: 💡 Everyone thinks of 3 facts about themselves. 2 must be true, and 1 must be a lie.

SourceText: 🔷 Here are some examples: I hate cold weather, I love cold ice cream, and my favourite thing to learn about is maths.
text: 🔷 Here are some examples: I hate cold weather, I love cold ice cream, and my favourite thing to learn about is maths.

SourceText: 👀 Share your facts with your children and ask them to guess which one is a lie.
text: 👀 Share your facts with your children and ask them to guess which one is a lie.

SourceText: 🔄 Now ask them to do the same, and guess theirs.
text: 🔄 Now ask them to do the same, and guess theirs.

SourceText: Did you learn anything new about your children, or did they learn anything new about you? 💛
text: Did you learn anything new about your children, or did they learn anything new about you? 💛

SourceText: *Yes, No or Maybe*
text: *Yes, No or Maybe*

SourceText: Are you tired of hearing your children say yes, no, or maybe to all of your questions? Turn your chat into a game, and don’t allow one-word answers. 🎈
text: Are you tired of hearing your children say yes, no, or maybe to all of your questions? Turn your chat into a game, and don’t allow one-word answers. 🎈

SourceText: 🔴 Older children are known to give one-word answers to avoid talking.
text: 🔴 Older children are known to give one-word answers to avoid talking.

SourceText: 💡 When you would like to really know how your children are doing, you can turn your chat into a game.
text: 💡 When you would like to really know how your children are doing, you can turn your chat into a game.

SourceText: ⭐ Take turns asking each other questions. The only rule is that you cannot use one-word responses like Yes, No, Maybe, Fine, and Okay.
text: ⭐ Take turns asking each other questions. The only rule is that you cannot use one-word responses like Yes, No, Maybe, Fine, and Okay.

SourceText: ⚽ You can ask about things your children like or what they did today. For example, how was your day? What are you excited about? What is one thing that is worrying you today?
text: ⚽ You can ask about things your children like or what they did today. For example, how was your day? What are you excited about? What is one thing that is worrying you today?

SourceText: 🔄 It is important to let your children ask you questions as well. Trust is built when your children can see that you are also sharing your life with them and not only trying to learn about their life.
text: 🔄 It is important to let your children ask you questions as well. Trust is built when your children can see that you are also sharing your life with them and not only trying to learn about their life.

SourceText: *Get Active*
text: *Get Active*

SourceText: Exercise is a great way to spend time together, and it is so good for your health🌱. Find an exercise activity that both you and your children want to do and try it out together! Be mindful of the safety of the space you are using for exercise.
text: Exercise is a great way to spend time together, and it is so good for your health🌱. Find an exercise activity that both you and your children want to do and try it out together! Be mindful of the safety of the space you are using for exercise.

SourceText: ⏰ Even walking for 10 minutes a day is good for you.
text: ⏰ Even walking for 10 minutes a day is good for you.

SourceText: ⚽Together, try walking, running, stretching, playing games like hide-and-seek, or any other physical activities you enjoy.
text: ⚽Together, try walking, running, stretching, playing games like hide-and-seek, or any other physical activities you enjoy.

SourceText: 🏆 Together, think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you run to a certain point? Take turns being the coach? Can there be a small, free reward like getting to decide the next activity?
text: 🏆 Together, think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you run to a certain point? Take turns being the coach? Can there be a small, free reward like getting to decide the next activity?

SourceText: Exercise becomes easier and more enjoyable the more you do it.
text: Exercise becomes easier and more enjoyable the more you do it.

SourceText: 🔄 If you or your children do not like the first type of exercise you pick, try a new way to exercise.
text: 🔄 If you or your children do not like the first type of exercise you pick, try a new way to exercise.

SourceText: *Take a Pause With Your Children*
text: *Take a Pause With Your Children*

SourceText: Take a pause with your children. This helps them deal with stress in a healthy way!
text: Take a pause with your children. This helps them deal with stress in a healthy way!

SourceText: ⏰ You could take a pause together at any time, or you could try at a specific time like before bedtime.
text: ⏰ You could take a pause together at any time, or you could try at a specific time like before bedtime.

SourceText: 👂 Sit down together and close your eyes. Listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel.
text: 👂 Sit down together and close your eyes. Listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel.

SourceText: ⭐ Take 5 more deep breaths.
text: ⭐ Take 5 more deep breaths.

SourceText: 👀 When you are ready, open your eyes again. Do you feel any different?
text: 👀 When you are ready, open your eyes again. Do you feel any different?

SourceText: ⏸ Ask your children what it was like to take a pause. Listen and accept whatever they say about it.
text: ⏸ Ask your children what it was like to take a pause. Listen and accept whatever they say about it.

SourceText: *This Is Who I Am*
text: *This Is Who I Am*

SourceText: Self-esteem is the way you value yourself, either in a positive or negative way. Helping your children have high self-esteem is a recipe for success! 🏆
text: Self-esteem is the way you value yourself, either in a positive or negative way. Helping your children have high self-esteem is a recipe for success! 🏆

SourceText: ⭐Share with your children 3 things you like about yourself!
text: ⭐Share with your children 3 things you like about yourself!

SourceText: 3️⃣ Ask your children to tell you 3 things they like about themselves.
text: 3️⃣ Ask your children to tell you 3 things they like about themselves.

SourceText: For example, I am great at treating others kindly. I am great at playing football. I am great at drawing flowers. If this is too hard, try thinking of just one thing.
text: For example, I am great at treating others kindly. I am great at playing football. I am great at drawing flowers. If this is too hard, try thinking of just one thing.

SourceText: *Weekly Goal Setting*
text: *Weekly Goal Setting*

SourceText: Let’s set some goals ⭐
text: Let’s set some goals ⭐

SourceText: ⏰ It can be helpful to set smaller weekly goals that are easier to reach, especially when life feels uncertain.
text: ⏰ It can be helpful to set smaller weekly goals that are easier to reach, especially when life feels uncertain.

SourceText: 💡Ask each of your children for one goal that they would like to achieve this week.
text: 💡Ask each of your children for one goal that they would like to achieve this week.

SourceText: 🔄 Make sure this goal is *specific* and *achievable* to reach in 1 week, like: practising deep breathing for 5 minutes every day, exercising for 10 minutes three times a week, journaling feelings every night, or spending quality time with family or friends daily.
text: 🔄 Make sure this goal is *specific* and *achievable* to reach in 1 week, like: practising deep breathing for 5 minutes every day, exercising for 10 minutes three times a week, journaling feelings every night, or spending quality time with family or friends daily.

SourceText: 💚 You can also share your own weekly goals with your children and support each other so you can both achieve your goals.
text: 💚 You can also share your own weekly goals with your children and support each other so you can both achieve your goals.

SourceText: 🎉 Make sure to praise and celebrate your children for their hard work towards reaching their goals.
text: 🎉 Make sure to praise and celebrate your children for their hard work towards reaching their goals.

SourceText: 🔔 If your children do not reach their goals, that is okay. Discuss with them the steps they still need to take or how they could reach it a different way.
text: 🔔 If your children do not reach their goals, that is okay. Discuss with them the steps they still need to take or how they could reach it a different way.

SourceText: *One-on-One Time*
text: *One-on-One Time*

SourceText: 💚 Spending time just with your children and taking an interest in them can improve your relationship.
text: 💚 Spending time just with your children and taking an interest in them can improve your relationship.

SourceText: 👀 When your children are playing alone or occupying themselves, join them and show interest in what they are doing.
text: 👀 When your children are playing alone or occupying themselves, join them and show interest in what they are doing.

SourceText: 👂Ask questions about their activity and listen to them.
text: 👂Ask questions about their activity and listen to them.

SourceText: Let your children lead the activity and follow them to build their confidence and autonomy. 😃
text: Let your children lead the activity and follow them to build their confidence and autonomy. 😃

SourceText: 👀 Say what you see - describing everything and supporting your children’s actions.
text: 👀 Say what you see - describing everything and supporting your children’s actions.

SourceText: Be positive, praise your children and enjoy spending this time with them. 😃💚
text: Be positive, praise your children and enjoy spending this time with them. 😃💚

SourceText: *Animals*
text: *Animals*

SourceText: 🧸 **Active Animals**
text: 🧸 **Active Animals**

SourceText: Take turns with your children doing animal actions. You might hop like a frog, stretch like a cat, run like a dog, slither like a snake, or flap like a bird. Add your own actions and animals!
text: Take turns with your children doing animal actions. You might hop like a frog, stretch like a cat, run like a dog, slither like a snake, or flap like a bird. Add your own actions and animals!

SourceText: 💡**All the Animals We Can Think Of**
text: 💡**All the Animals We Can Think Of**

SourceText: Think about groups of animals and talk about them with your children!
text: Think about groups of animals and talk about them with your children!

SourceText: What are all the animals we can think of that have feathers? What are all the animals we can think of that eat plants? 🌱 What animals can we think of that lay eggs?
text: What are all the animals we can think of that have feathers? What are all the animals we can think of that eat plants? 🌱 What animals can we think of that lay eggs?

SourceText: *Active Counting*
text: *Active Counting*

SourceText: 👋 **Clap, hop, jump**
text: 👋 **Clap, hop, jump**

SourceText: Play the following game with your children. Make it active!
text: Play the following game with your children. Make it active!

SourceText: 1️⃣ Clap hands 1 time.
text: 1️⃣ Clap hands 1 time.

SourceText: 2️⃣ Clap hands 2 times.
text: 2️⃣ Clap hands 2 times.

SourceText: 1️⃣ Jump 1 time.
text: 1️⃣ Jump 1 time.

SourceText: 2️⃣ Jump 2 times.
text: 2️⃣ Jump 2 times.

SourceText: 1️⃣ Hop 1 time.
text: 1️⃣ Hop 1 time.

SourceText: 3️⃣ Hop 3 times.
text: 3️⃣ Hop 3 times.

SourceText: 💡 Can you hop, then jump, then clap?
text: 💡 Can you hop, then jump, then clap?

SourceText: 🏆 Can you clap twice, jump once, and hop three times?
text: 🏆 Can you clap twice, jump once, and hop three times?

SourceText: 💡 **Remembering Instructions**
text: 💡 **Remembering Instructions**

SourceText: Take turns playing a game where you give 2-3 instructions that the other person has to remember to follow. Make sure physical movement is included!
text: Take turns playing a game where you give 2-3 instructions that the other person has to remember to follow. Make sure physical movement is included!

SourceText: For example:
text: For example:

SourceText: Hop twice, turn around.
text: Hop twice, turn around.

SourceText: Take ten steps forward, three steps to the side and sit down. ✅
text: Take ten steps forward, three steps to the side and sit down. ✅

SourceText: *Active Songs*
text: *Active Songs*

SourceText: 😃 Young children love physical games but they need reminders about how to play. 💡
text: 😃 Young children love physical games but they need reminders about how to play. 💡

SourceText: 🎵 Songs with movements are fun and active and give instructions on how to move!
text: 🎵 Songs with movements are fun and active and give instructions on how to move!

SourceText: Sing songs to your children in which they have to follow instructions like:
text: Sing songs to your children in which they have to follow instructions like:

SourceText: You are not alone 🤲. Many other people are also going through very hard times, including war or having to leave their homes 💔. Many people share your pain as you face so many losses and uncertainties.
text: You are not alone 🤲. Many other people are also going through very hard times, including war or having to leave their homes 💔. Many people share your pain as you face so many losses and uncertainties.

SourceText: When life is this hard, it's normal to feel overwhelmed 😣.
text: When life is this hard, it's normal to feel overwhelmed 😣.

SourceText: Today’s tips are about ways you can take care of yourself 🌱, even when it is very difficult.
text: Today’s tips are about ways you can take care of yourself 🌱, even when it is very difficult.

SourceText: Remember, when you take good care of yourself, it can help you take good care of your children.
text: Remember, when you take good care of yourself, it can help you take good care of your children.

SourceText: Press Play ▶️ to learn 3️⃣ tips to help you care for yourself so you can care for your children:
text: Press Play ▶️ to learn 3️⃣ tips to help you care for yourself so you can care for your children:

SourceText: 1️⃣ **BREATHE**
text: 1️⃣ **BREATHE**

SourceText: 2️⃣ **BREATHE TOGETHER WITH YOUR CHILDREN**
text: 2️⃣ **BREATHE TOGETHER WITH YOUR CHILDREN**

SourceText: 3️⃣ **CONNECT AND SHARE**
text: 3️⃣ **CONNECT AND SHARE**

SourceText: Here are 3️⃣ tips to help:
text: Here are 3️⃣ tips to help:

SourceText: Listen to your breath 🌬️ as it goes in and out.
text: Listen to your breath 🌬️ as it goes in and out.

SourceText: Place your hands on your chest or tummy and feel how it rises and falls with each breath.
text: Place your hands on your chest or tummy and feel how it rises and falls with each breath.

SourceText: Then, listen to your breath in a calm, gentle way for a while🌄.
text: Then, listen to your breath in a calm, gentle way for a while🌄.

SourceText: 🗓️ Do these breathing practices every day together with your children. It will help you and them learn to manage stress 🌱.
text: 🗓️ Do these breathing practices every day together with your children. It will help you and them learn to manage stress 🌱.

SourceText: If your stress feels overwhelming, please contact a trusted person, organisation or helpline. Type {HELP} after these tips for more information.
text: If your stress feels overwhelming, please contact a trusted person, organisation or helpline. Type {HELP} after these tips for more information.

SourceText: 💙 Thank you for joining us today. You are truly great.
text: 💙 Thank you for joining us today. You are truly great.

SourceText: Coping with your fears and stresses 🌊 is the first step to caring for yourself 💪 and helping others 🤝.
text: Coping with your fears and stresses 🌊 is the first step to caring for yourself 💪 and helping others 🤝.

SourceText: In these times, it can be hard for us as parents to help our children feel secure.
text: In these times, it can be hard for us as parents to help our children feel secure.

SourceText: Today's tips are about helping your children cope with trauma from war, displacement, and other hardships 🌍💔.
text: Today's tips are about helping your children cope with trauma from war, displacement, and other hardships 🌍💔.

SourceText: It is possible that your children are feeling upset, angry, or confused. They need your support.
text: It is possible that your children are feeling upset, angry, or confused. They need your support.

SourceText: There are some simple things you can do! 🌟
text: There are some simple things you can do! 🌟

SourceText: Press Play ▶️ to learn 5️⃣ tips on how you can support your children during these tough times:
text: Press Play ▶️ to learn 5️⃣ tips on how you can support your children during these tough times:

SourceText: 1️⃣ **LISTEN**
text: 1️⃣ **LISTEN**

SourceText: 2️⃣ **ACCEPT & BE SENSITIVE**
text: 2️⃣ **ACCEPT & BE SENSITIVE**

SourceText: 3️⃣ **BE HONEST**
text: 3️⃣ **BE HONEST**

SourceText: 4️⃣ **PRAISE YOURSELF AND YOUR CHILDREN**
text: 4️⃣ **PRAISE YOURSELF AND YOUR CHILDREN**

SourceText: 5️⃣ **THERE IS HELP**
text: 5️⃣ **THERE IS HELP**

SourceText: Here are 5️⃣ tips on how you can support your children during these times:
text: Here are 5️⃣ tips on how you can support your children during these times:

SourceText: 👂 Listen to your children carefully when they express their feelings and try to empathise.
text: 👂 Listen to your children carefully when they express their feelings and try to empathise.

SourceText: 🌱 Accept whatever they are feeling and give them comfort that such feelings are quite normal under these circumstances.
text: 🌱 Accept whatever they are feeling and give them comfort that such feelings are quite normal under these circumstances.

SourceText: 🛑 If your children do not want to talk about this situation, do not insist.
text: 🛑 If your children do not want to talk about this situation, do not insist.

SourceText: If your children ask a question about what is happening, be honest in your response and share information that is appropriate for their age.
text: If your children ask a question about what is happening, be honest in your response and share information that is appropriate for their age.

SourceText: Try to have a compassionate attitude and accept any feelings they have.
text: Try to have a compassionate attitude and accept any feelings they have.

SourceText: 🌟 Every night, praise yourself and your children for something, however small.
text: 🌟 Every night, praise yourself and your children for something, however small.

SourceText: This will make you and your children feel better and will help build a caring relationship between you 🦋.
text: This will make you and your children feel better and will help build a caring relationship between you 🦋.

SourceText: 🤝If you have any concerns regarding a child’s feelings and behaviours, then please contact a trusted person, organisation, or helpline. Type {HELP} after these tips, or any time you need help, for more information.
text: 🤝If you have any concerns regarding a child’s feelings and behaviours, then please contact a trusted person, organisation, or helpline. Type {HELP} after these tips, or any time you need help, for more information.

SourceText: Thank you for joining us today 💙. No matter how upset or tired you are, you are amazing parents.
text: Thank you for joining us today 💙. No matter how upset or tired you are, you are amazing parents.

SourceText: Today's tips are about practical ways to cope during difficult times.
text: Today's tips are about practical ways to cope during difficult times.

SourceText: Even though it’s hard, try to practise simple daily habits 🗓️ because routines help children feel secure.
text: Even though it’s hard, try to practise simple daily habits 🗓️ because routines help children feel secure.

SourceText: Press Play ▶️ to learn 5️⃣ practical, daily habits you can do every day that will help you and your children cope with your current situation:
text: Press Play ▶️ to learn 5️⃣ practical, daily habits you can do every day that will help you and your children cope with your current situation:

SourceText: 1️⃣ **SPEND TIME TOGETHER**
text: 1️⃣ **SPEND TIME TOGETHER**

SourceText: 2️⃣ **ASK YOUR CHILDREN**
text: 2️⃣ **ASK YOUR CHILDREN**

SourceText: 3️⃣ **APPRECIATE YOUR CHILDREN**
text: 3️⃣ **APPRECIATE YOUR CHILDREN**

SourceText: 4️⃣ **HELP OTHERS**
text: 4️⃣ **HELP OTHERS**

SourceText: 5️⃣ **BE PRESENT**
text: 5️⃣ **BE PRESENT**

SourceText: Here are 5️⃣ tips for building practical habits you can do every day that will help you and your children cope with your current situation:
text: Here are 5️⃣ tips for building practical habits you can do every day that will help you and your children cope with your current situation:

SourceText: If it is possible, try to make a routine for spending time together 🕒.
text: If it is possible, try to make a routine for spending time together 🕒.

SourceText: 🔁 You can engage children in daily activities, such as telling a story, praying together, or sharing at least one meal together.
text: 🔁 You can engage children in daily activities, such as telling a story, praying together, or sharing at least one meal together.

SourceText: Ask children what they want to do.
text: Ask children what they want to do.

SourceText: If you can’t do that activity now, it’s still a chance to connect with your children emotionally 🤍.
text: If you can’t do that activity now, it’s still a chance to connect with your children emotionally 🤍.

SourceText: After this lesson, you can type {PLAY} to get some activity ideas to do with children 📝.
text: After this lesson, you can type {PLAY} to get some activity ideas to do with children 📝.

SourceText: Take a moment every day to appreciate your children for engaging in activities with you 🌿.
text: Take a moment every day to appreciate your children for engaging in activities with you 🌿.

SourceText: Helping others can also make you feel better 🤍. Even a smile can help someone else feel better 🌱.
text: Helping others can also make you feel better 🤍. Even a smile can help someone else feel better 🌱.

SourceText: Our children can learn calmness and kindness from us 💙.
text: Our children can learn calmness and kindness from us 💙.

SourceText: When spending time with your children, be as present as possible. Listen to them👂 and look at them 👀 when they talk.
text: When spending time with your children, be as present as possible. Listen to them👂 and look at them 👀 when they talk.

SourceText: Pay your full attention to them, this will help validate, reassure, and comfort children 🤍.
text: Pay your full attention to them, this will help validate, reassure, and comfort children 🤍.

SourceText: You’ve completed 50% of this tip! Press NEXT to continue.
text: You’ve completed 50% of this tip! Press NEXT to continue.

SourceText: Here are some regular activities you might want to try to do with your children:
text: Here are some regular activities you might want to try to do with your children:

text: Share one meal together

SourceText: Getting ready to sleep
text: Getting ready to sleep

SourceText: Exercise daily
text: Exercise daily

SourceText: Daily play activities
text: Daily play activities

SourceText: Thank you for joining us 💙.
text: Thank you for joining us 💙.

SourceText: Our children learn to show peace, love, and empathy from us 🌿.
text: Our children learn to show peace, love, and empathy from us 🌿.

SourceText: Playing and talking to children every day helps them feel secure 🛡️. You’re doing so much to care for your children! 🌟
text: Playing and talking to children every day helps them feel secure 🛡️. You’re doing so much to care for your children! 🌟

SourceText: In these times that are so hard, we often have extra stress and tension, and it’s normal that we feel more anger.
text: In these times that are so hard, we often have extra stress and tension, and it’s normal that we feel more anger.

SourceText: In case of any uncertainty, children observe and imitate the behaviours of their elders 👀.
text: In case of any uncertainty, children observe and imitate the behaviours of their elders 👀.

SourceText: Children can learn to be calm from us, which helps them face challenges 🌸.
text: Children can learn to be calm from us, which helps them face challenges 🌸.

SourceText: Press Play ▶️ to learn 4️⃣ tips that can help you cope with negative emotions while encouraging children:
text: Press Play ▶️ to learn 4️⃣ tips that can help you cope with negative emotions while encouraging children:

SourceText: 1️⃣ **SHARE YOUR FEELINGS**
text: 1️⃣ **SHARE YOUR FEELINGS**

SourceText: 2️⃣ **BREATHE**
text: 2️⃣ **BREATHE**

SourceText: 3️⃣ **REASSURE YOUR CHILD**
text: 3️⃣ **REASSURE YOUR CHILD**

SourceText: 4️⃣ **THERE ARE PEOPLE WHO CARE**
text: 4️⃣ **THERE ARE PEOPLE WHO CARE**

SourceText: Here are 4️⃣ tips that can help you cope with negative emotions and also encourage your children:
text: Here are 4️⃣ tips that can help you cope with negative emotions and also encourage your children:

SourceText: When you are feeling stress, tension or anger, find someone who you can share your feelings with, like a family member or friend.
text: When you are feeling stress, tension or anger, find someone who you can share your feelings with, like a family member or friend.

SourceText: Avoid substance abuse as a stress coping mechanism.
text: Avoid substance abuse as a stress coping mechanism.

SourceText: If your stress feels overwhelming, you can contact an organization or helpline for extra support. Type {HELP} after these tips for more information🤲.
text: If your stress feels overwhelming, you can contact an organization or helpline for extra support. Type {HELP} after these tips for more information🤲.

SourceText: When you feel extremely angry, take a ten-second break or pause before you engage with anyone, including your children ⏸️.
text: When you feel extremely angry, take a ten-second break or pause before you engage with anyone, including your children ⏸️.

SourceText: Take five deep breaths🌬️.
text: Take five deep breaths🌬️.

SourceText: Then try to respond in a calmer way 🕊️.
text: Then try to respond in a calmer way 🕊️.

SourceText: 3️⃣ **REASSURE YOUR CHILDREN**
text: 3️⃣ **REASSURE YOUR CHILDREN**

SourceText: It’s ok to show your concern and emotions to your children 💬. This will help them learn about their own emotions. It’s also good to remind them that we believe that one day hope and justice will prevail ✨.
text: It’s ok to show your concern and emotions to your children 💬. This will help them learn about their own emotions. It’s also good to remind them that we believe that one day hope and justice will prevail ✨.

SourceText: Reassure your children that one day, war will end and our community will be able to rebuild and thrive together 🌿.
text: Reassure your children that one day, war will end and our community will be able to rebuild and thrive together 🌿.

SourceText: Share stories with them of how people in the past have worked together and come out of traumatic situations 📖.
text: Share stories with them of how people in the past have worked together and come out of traumatic situations 📖.

SourceText: Assure your children that friends, relatives, or charitable organisations will try to find ways to help them in these situations 🤲.
text: Assure your children that friends, relatives, or charitable organisations will try to find ways to help them in these situations 🤲.

SourceText: Thank you for being here with us today 💙. Be proud of yourself every time you manage your negative feelings and encourage your children. You are an amazing parent! ✨
text: Thank you for being here with us today 💙. Be proud of yourself every time you manage your negative feelings and encourage your children. You are an amazing parent! ✨

SourceText: In today's tips, we will talk about some simple safety plans you can make with your children 📝.
text: In today's tips, we will talk about some simple safety plans you can make with your children 📝.

SourceText: It can help your children when they see that you have plans 💙.
text: It can help your children when they see that you have plans 💙.

SourceText: Press Play ▶️ to learn 4️⃣ tips to help you get ready to travel with children in a crisis situation:
text: Press Play ▶️ to learn 4️⃣ tips to help you get ready to travel with children in a crisis situation:

SourceText: 1️⃣ **PROTECT YOUR DOCUMENTS**
text: 1️⃣ **PROTECT YOUR DOCUMENTS**

SourceText: 2️⃣ **HIDE MONEY**
text: 2️⃣ **HIDE MONEY**

SourceText: 3️⃣ **SUPERVISE YOUR CHILDREN**
text: 3️⃣ **SUPERVISE YOUR CHILDREN**

SourceText: 4️⃣ **COMMUNICATE WITH YOUR CHILDREN**
text: 4️⃣ **COMMUNICATE WITH YOUR CHILDREN**

SourceText: Here are 4️⃣ tips to help you plan for safety with your children:
text: Here are 4️⃣ tips to help you plan for safety with your children:

SourceText: Take pictures 📷 or make copies of any identity documents or cards and hide these in separate secure places 🛡️.
text: Take pictures 📷 or make copies of any identity documents or cards and hide these in separate secure places 🛡️.

SourceText: Also hide any money you have separately in different places, so that if something is lost, you won’t lose everything 💙.
text: Also hide any money you have separately in different places, so that if something is lost, you won’t lose everything 💙.

SourceText: 🤍 Try your best to keep children with you or someone you trust.
text: 🤍 Try your best to keep children with you or someone you trust.

SourceText: Make sure you know that the people your children spend time with in person and online are trustworthy ✔️.
text: Make sure you know that the people your children spend time with in person and online are trustworthy ✔️.

SourceText: Tell your children they should not spend time outside alone after dark 🚫 or take a lift with someone alone.
text: Tell your children they should not spend time outside alone after dark 🚫 or take a lift with someone alone.

SourceText: Thank you for joining us today. 🌟 Praise yourself for doing the best you can.
text: Thank you for joining us today. 🌟 Praise yourself for doing the best you can.

SourceText: In these tips, we will talk about ways you can be prepared to travel safely with your children 💙.
text: In these tips, we will talk about ways you can be prepared to travel safely with your children 💙.

SourceText: Your children will feel reassured knowing you have a plan 📝.
text: Your children will feel reassured knowing you have a plan 📝.

SourceText: Press Play ▶️ to learn 3 things you can do to ensure that you and your children are as safe as possible when you are on the move:
text: Press Play ▶️ to learn 3 things you can do to ensure that you and your children are as safe as possible when you are on the move:

SourceText: 1️⃣ **MOVE SAFELY**
text: 1️⃣ **MOVE SAFELY**

SourceText: 2️⃣ **PREPARE YOUR CHILDREN**
text: 2️⃣ **PREPARE YOUR CHILDREN**

SourceText: 3️⃣ **MAKE A SAFETY NOTE**
text: 3️⃣ **MAKE A SAFETY NOTE**

SourceText: Here are 3️⃣ things you can do to ensure that you and your children are as safe as possible when you are on the move:
text: Here are 3️⃣ things you can do to ensure that you and your children are as safe as possible when you are on the move:

SourceText: 🔒 Travel in a group of people you know, and don’t give any ID documents or cards to anyone, where possible.
text: 🔒 Travel in a group of people you know, and don’t give any ID documents or cards to anyone, where possible.

SourceText: 🎵Make a song or chant with your children to help them memorise your full name and phone number, and number of someone you trust.
text: 🎵Make a song or chant with your children to help them memorise your full name and phone number, and number of someone you trust.

SourceText: 🔁 Go over it every day.
text: 🔁 Go over it every day.

SourceText: 📍Every day, agree on a clear place to meet if you are separated from each other.
text: 📍Every day, agree on a clear place to meet if you are separated from each other.

SourceText: 🗒️ Make a safety note for each child.
text: 🗒️ Make a safety note for each child.

SourceText: Write the full name & phone number of yourself and three people you trust, plus any medication your child needs and any special needs they have.
text: Write the full name & phone number of yourself and three people you trust, plus any medication your child needs and any special needs they have.

SourceText: Cover the note in plastic and hide it in something they always wear.
text: Cover the note in plastic and hide it in something they always wear.

SourceText: Thank you for joining us 💙. You are being prepared – we are proud of you 🌟.
text: Thank you for joining us 💙. You are being prepared – we are proud of you 🌟.

SourceText: Today's tips are about protecting our children from harassment.
text: Today's tips are about protecting our children from harassment.

SourceText: During difficult times, children are more likely to face harassment.
text: During difficult times, children are more likely to face harassment.

SourceText: Talking to children about these things can help keep them safe 🛡️.
text: Talking to children about these things can help keep them safe 🛡️.

SourceText: Press Play ▶️ to learn 3️⃣ tips for protecting your children from harassment:
text: Press Play ▶️ to learn 3️⃣ tips for protecting your children from harassment:

SourceText: 2️⃣ **TEACH YOUR CHILDREN**
text: 2️⃣ **TEACH YOUR CHILDREN**

SourceText: 3️⃣ **COMFORT YOUR CHILDREN**
text: 3️⃣ **COMFORT YOUR CHILDREN**

SourceText: Here are 3️⃣ tips for protecting your children from harassment:
text: Here are 3️⃣ tips for protecting your children from harassment:

SourceText: Teach your children that nobody has the right to touch them.
text: Teach your children that nobody has the right to touch them.

SourceText: In order to stop someone who tries to do that, practice saying and shouting “NO” with your children.
text: In order to stop someone who tries to do that, practice saying and shouting “NO” with your children.

SourceText: Talk to your children about dangerous people and places. Make plans together about how to avoid danger.
text: Talk to your children about dangerous people and places. Make plans together about how to avoid danger.

SourceText: If your children tell you they were abused, always believe them.
text: If your children tell you they were abused, always believe them.

SourceText: Tell them that it’s not their fault and you love them 💙.
text: Tell them that it’s not their fault and you love them 💙.

SourceText: You can type {HELP} for resources if your children share about abuse with you.
text: You can type {HELP} for resources if your children share about abuse with you.

SourceText: Thank you for joining us today💙. Remember that talking to children about these things helps keep them safe.
text: Thank you for joining us today💙. Remember that talking to children about these things helps keep them safe.

SourceText: These tips are about helping your children in the case of loved ones dying.
text: These tips are about helping your children in the case of loved ones dying.

SourceText: Losing a loved one is painful for everyone, including children.
text: Losing a loved one is painful for everyone, including children.

SourceText: It is possible that your children appear to be happy but deep inside are sad.
text: It is possible that your children appear to be happy but deep inside are sad.

SourceText: Talking to your children about death can be hard, but it will help them make sense of what is happening.
text: Talking to your children about death can be hard, but it will help them make sense of what is happening.

SourceText: Here are 5️⃣ tips on how to help your children when loved ones die:
text: Here are 5️⃣ tips on how to help your children when loved ones die:

SourceText: 1️⃣ **TALK WITH CHILDREN**
text: 1️⃣ **TALK WITH CHILDREN**

SourceText: 2️⃣ **LISTEN AND ACCEPT**
text: 2️⃣ **LISTEN AND ACCEPT**

SourceText: 3️⃣ **SAY GOODBYE**
text: 3️⃣ **SAY GOODBYE**

SourceText: 4️⃣ **NO BLAMING**
text: 4️⃣ **NO BLAMING**

SourceText: 5️⃣ **BE CLEAR**
text: 5️⃣ **BE CLEAR**

SourceText: Children often sense the pain of loss or death, even if they don't know yet what happened.
text: Children often sense the pain of loss or death, even if they don't know yet what happened.

SourceText: Tell them in simple and honest words that the person has passed away.
text: Tell them in simple and honest words that the person has passed away.

SourceText: 💙Be sensitive to their emotions and try to create a compassionate space when you talk with them about the death of loved ones.
text: 💙Be sensitive to their emotions and try to create a compassionate space when you talk with them about the death of loved ones.

SourceText: Listen to your children. Accept anything they are feeling and show them affection.
text: Listen to your children. Accept anything they are feeling and show them affection.

SourceText: Do something together to say goodbye to the person who had died – consider a prayer 🤲 or a letter 📃.
text: Do something together to say goodbye to the person who had died – consider a prayer 🤲 or a letter 📃.

SourceText: Sometimes we feel like loss is our fault, even when it is not, and children may feel this way too.
text: Sometimes we feel like loss is our fault, even when it is not, and children may feel this way too.

SourceText: Many people have these feelings. Remind yourself it’s not your fault and help your children see it’s not their fault either 💙.
text: Many people have these feelings. Remind yourself it’s not your fault and help your children see it’s not their fault either 💙.

SourceText: Tell children clearly who will be taking care of them now, if a change needs to happen.
text: Tell children clearly who will be taking care of them now, if a change needs to happen.

SourceText: Let us understand how children of different ages react to death so we can support them.
text: Let us understand how children of different ages react to death so we can support them.

SourceText: Small children under the age of 5 years may ask if the person who has died is coming back.
text: Small children under the age of 5 years may ask if the person who has died is coming back.

SourceText: They might hold onto you or other caregivers more or start doing things they used to do when they were younger, like wetting the bed.
text: They might hold onto you or other caregivers more or start doing things they used to do when they were younger, like wetting the bed.

SourceText: Older children between 6 and 11 years old may ask more questions and want to understand what happened.
text: Older children between 6 and 11 years old may ask more questions and want to understand what happened.

SourceText: They may show their grief through anger and experience physical aches or pains.
text: They may show their grief through anger and experience physical aches or pains.

SourceText: Adolescents and young teenagers from around the age of 12 years will wonder about why things happen.
text: Adolescents and young teenagers from around the age of 12 years will wonder about why things happen.

SourceText: Their reactions will vary and can include lack of interest, anger, extreme sadness and poor concentration.
text: Their reactions will vary and can include lack of interest, anger, extreme sadness and poor concentration.

SourceText: Thank you for joining us.
text: Thank you for joining us.

SourceText: If your grief feels overwhelming, contact a trusted person, organisation or helpline by typing {HELP}.
text: If your grief feels overwhelming, contact a trusted person, organisation or helpline by typing {HELP}.

SourceText: Take some moments for yourself to grieve for your losses 💔. Grieving is the pathway to healing for you and your children.
text: Take some moments for yourself to grieve for your losses 💔. Grieving is the pathway to healing for you and your children.

SourceText: Congratulations on reaching our final set of tips! 🎉 Here we are talking about ways to build your and your children’s strength and to encourage good behaviours in them.
text: Congratulations on reaching our final set of tips! 🎉 Here we are talking about ways to build your and your children’s strength and to encourage good behaviours in them.

SourceText: Even in these times that are so hard, there is hope that you can build strength, and when your children sense your love and appreciation, it helps them build their own strength, too. 🦋
text: Even in these times that are so hard, there is hope that you can build strength, and when your children sense your love and appreciation, it helps them build their own strength, too. 🦋

SourceText: Press Play ▶️ to learn 2️⃣ simple tips that can help you encourage your children to build strength:
text: Press Play ▶️ to learn 2️⃣ simple tips that can help you encourage your children to build strength:

SourceText: 1️⃣ **INVOLVE YOUR CHILDREN**
text: 1️⃣ **INVOLVE YOUR CHILDREN**

SourceText: 2️⃣ **PRAISE THEM**
text: 2️⃣ **PRAISE THEM**

SourceText: Here are 2️⃣ simple tips that can help you to encourage your children to build strength:
text: Here are 2️⃣ simple tips that can help you to encourage your children to build strength:

SourceText: Ask children to help in simple chores 💪. This will give them a sense of responsibility.
text: Ask children to help in simple chores 💪. This will give them a sense of responsibility.

SourceText: 💙Appreciate children when they are trying or doing something good.
text: 💙Appreciate children when they are trying or doing something good.

SourceText: This will help them to do good again.
text: This will help them to do good again.

SourceText: 🌟 Praising children shows them that you notice and care, and helps build confidence.
text: 🌟 Praising children shows them that you notice and care, and helps build confidence.

SourceText: You can also build your own strength 💪 by remembering that you are not alone.
text: You can also build your own strength 💪 by remembering that you are not alone.

SourceText: Sharing your sorrow and worries with someone you trust often helps lighten the burden 🤝.
text: Sharing your sorrow and worries with someone you trust often helps lighten the burden 🤝.

SourceText: If your sorrow and worries feel overwhelming, please contact a trusted person, organisation or helpline. Type {HELP} after these tips for more information.
text: If your sorrow and worries feel overwhelming, please contact a trusted person, organisation or helpline. Type {HELP} after these tips for more information.

SourceText: Thank you for being here with us today and for all our tips 💙. You are doing so much to care for yourself and your children.
text: Thank you for being here with us today and for all our tips 💙. You are doing so much to care for yourself and your children.

SourceText: Remember that appreciating your children makes them realise that you give them attention and love 🤍. You can be proud of yourself.  You are truly great 🌟!
text: Remember that appreciating your children makes them realise that you give them attention and love 🤍. You can be proud of yourself.  You are truly great 🌟!

SourceText: **Let's take a pause together.**
text: **Let's take a pause together.**

SourceText: Remember, this is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed.
text: Remember, this is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed.

SourceText: Press ▶️ to take a pause together.
text: Press ▶️ to take a pause together.

SourceText: Thank you for taking a moment to pause with us. It's time for today's tips.
text: Thank you for taking a moment to pause with us. It's time for today's tips.

SourceText: **Let’s take a pause together.**
text: **Let’s take a pause together.**

SourceText: Whenever you’re feeling stressed, remember that taking a pause like this can help you feel more grounded and calm.
text: Whenever you’re feeling stressed, remember that taking a pause like this can help you feel more grounded and calm.

SourceText: Sometimes when we are experiencing stress or feeling alone, it can be helpful to send thoughts of loving kindness to ourselves.
text: Sometimes when we are experiencing stress or feeling alone, it can be helpful to send thoughts of loving kindness to ourselves.

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience.
text: Take a moment to reflect on your experience.

SourceText: When you are ready, continue to today's tips with a sense of calm.
text: When you are ready, continue to today's tips with a sense of calm.

SourceText: Thank you for taking a moment to pause with us.
text: Thank you for taking a moment to pause with us.

SourceText: You can do this anytime you feel stressed or worried.
text: You can do this anytime you feel stressed or worried.
